body_html:
@gunan I updated the PR. Now in Windows the behavior remains the same while on Linux it will use PYTHON_BIN_PATH.

I tried a python 3 only of Ubuntu 18.04 (only /usr/bin/python3, no /usr/bin/python). The following command builds successfully:

bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Please take a look and let me know if there are any issues.
body_text:
@gunan I updated the PR. Now in Windows the behavior remains the same while on Linux it will use PYTHON_BIN_PATH.
I tried a python 3 only of Ubuntu 18.04 (only /usr/bin/python3, no /usr/bin/python). The following command builds successfully:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Please take a look and let me know if there are any issues.
body:
@gunan I updated the PR. Now in Windows the behavior remains the same while on Linux it will use `PYTHON_BIN_PATH`.

I tried a python 3 only of `Ubuntu 18.04` (only `/usr/bin/python3`, no `/usr/bin/python`). The following command builds successfully:
```
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```

Please take a look and let me know if there are any issues.
